result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S Bryan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution, if any is requested, plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action .  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with victims, Jeremy & Jennifer E.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Jail time applies to Ct. 4. Jail time is stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.
To perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew S Bryan in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Andrew S Bryan in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State amends Ct. 1 to Misdemeanor Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct. 1 and Cts. 2, 3, 4 & 5 as charged.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1 and Cts. 2, 3, 4 & 5 as charged. Court dismisses Ct. 6 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense give joint sentencing recommendation. Bond is no longer in effect.
from Atty Reetz asking court to reschedule 12/29/14 hearing due to a conflict. Court reschedules.
Status conference on January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Andrew S Bryan in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Andrew S Bryan in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz advises he's not been appointed by PD office to represent defendant. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Andrew S Bryan in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Defendant Andrew S Bryan in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Atty Erickson advises new counsel will have to be appointed as he isn't handling felony cases yet. Court reschedules. Bond remain in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 11/15/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 1/21/15)

No contact direct or indirect with J.E. & J.E. and their residence.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Andrew S Bryan appears by video conference along with attorney Greb Gerbers who appears in person.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 12/01/14 at 10:00 AM.
